Reviews.Title: “Convenient, no frills.”
Reviews.Author: jnegri
Reviews.Content: My family and I (eight people) needed a place to stay only one night in Miami after arriving there on a late flight and renting two cars and before driving the next morning to Orlando. We were lucky to find the Staybridge Suites. But let me elaborate on the dual meaning of this sentence: the hotel is perfect for the type of quick and simple stay we needed. Large and clean rooms, with well furnished kitchenette and all basic needs of a tired family duly covered. Excellent breakfast (nice surprise!) the following morning. But trying to find the Staybridge at night upon arrival at Miami Airport was a very complicated task. If you miss the entrance (marked by an unlit sign that is difficult to see) you can wander for hours until you find your way to it. Also, sometimes it may be difficult to find a parking place in the hotel's lot, shared by patrons from a noisy bar in the vicinity. Our rooms faced the parking lot, so we had a peaceful sleep, but I imagine that whoever faced the bar may have had a difficult time trying to sleep. But let these details not miss the basic virtues of the Staybridge: more than reasonable rates, clean and spacious rooms, very polite staff, both at the front desk and at the breakfast area. A nice find.

Reviews.Title: “Great homely place”
Reviews.Author: Cru22
Reviews.Content: Very clean well-equipped rooms with very comfortable bed. Kevin on front desk very helpful,I had a late flight and he let me check-out late at no extra cost which is usually a problem in other hotels. Laid-back feel,shuttle to airport so very convenient,great place.

Reviews.Title: “Review Nov. 2011”
Reviews.Author: S L
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Staybridge Suites Doral for two weeks with my husband who is working here for a few weeks. We had a 2 room suite, with kitchen. The staff is very friendly and courteous and always there to help you.They have a wonderful free breakfast every morning and when I had to do laundry, it was free also. The rooms are very clean and the indoor & outdoor areas are kept very tidy and clean. Their internet could be faster .Downstairs they have an internet area and library. There's a free trolley service in Doral to go to the mall & stores and it also goes to the metro-rail. There's also the Metro bus service it costs $2.00 per way. Call 311 to get routes. There is a restaurant right next to the hotel which you could walk to, called The Doral Ale House, which had a great menu & huge sports bar area. We would definitely return and stay here at Staybridge Suites, Doral(Miami) Florida again, an truly enjoyable experience. Sharon L.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: AMad04
Reviews.Content: My family and I normally stay with Staybridge when we travel, so when I found one in Miami, I had to book it no matter the cost. This was the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. This was a pre-cruise stay and we did NOT get off on a 'good foot'! The rooms are tiny, old and falling apart. Our toilet did not work, so we had to wait on a maintenance employee to come fix it, was not even offered another room. The pictures shown on the website are NOTHING like what is in person. I would not recommend this hotel to no one. I am beginning to think that the hotels in Miami are all horrible.

Reviews.Title: “overbooked and RUDE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: etmjb
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the airport 9 P.M. and called for pick up. The driver pulls in front of the Holiday inn 945 P.M. [part of the same property] and told me I will be staying here instead. Clerk at Holiday Inn told me my Staybridge room was flooded so they moved me over here. I took the room on protest and walked next door to the Staybridge. The very rude man out front told us the room was flooded. There were no water or flood damage vehicles out there. My wife asked if they overbooked so they call it a flood problem and the man rudely said yes. He then asked if we had booked on Priceline. My wife told him no it was on Hotwire. The man said call them with my complaints then. Hotwire offered to place us at another hotel after their talk with the same rude man. By then it was after 10 P.M. and needed to get up for a cruise in the morning. We stayed next door at the Holiday Inn and Hotwire compensated us for the problem. Terrible service and a terrible way to start a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome deal!”
Reviews.Author: ScreamingBanshee
Reviews.Content: Needed a one night's stay before a cruise and discovered this hotel online. Reviews were consistently good and the Entertainment rate was a steal so couldn't pass up. Good thing we didn't as this turned out to be a perfect pre-cruise stay. Called the hotel upon our arrival at the airport and they said a shuttle would be by to pick us up in 15 minutes. Well, 15 minutes later the shuttle came, which was a pleasant surprise given the fact that the hotel usually only does pickups once per hour, on the hour. Hotel is located 10-15 minutes away in a quiet area next to a Holiday Inn Express. Was greeted by a friendly front desk clerk who provided us with a welcome bag of water and chips for belonging to their reward program. N/S Room was huge with a kitchen area, sitting area, and a king bed. There is a great restaurant bar located just outside the hotel and the complimentary breakfast offered in the hotel is more than adequate with both hot items (eggs, some spam-like hash, waffles) and cold (yogurt, cereals, breads/pastries, fruit). Finding free tables was not a problem. Free internet is also available on 2 computers in their business centre. For those looking for an inexpensive, yet quality, place to stay short-term near the airport, this hotel is perfect. The free airport shuttle is convenient and cost-saving, and the taxi to the cruise terminal was less than $40 without tip. A super deal overall!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that cares”
Reviews.Author: Tiff91
Reviews.Content: Very nice, very clean hotel. Two-room suites that are well-maintained, including amenities such as kitchenette, television, etc. Good security (must use key card for elevator). Most important, the staff here cares- they've done everything they can to make my stay more comfortable, including upgrading me to a balcony room (I'm here for a while on business). Great breakfast, free wireless internet (that works!), and the evening dinner/reception Tues-Thurs is a great way to make your trip easier. This is not only a hotel I would stay on business, but I would be happy to bring my family with me. A big thank-you to the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: NYCruiseGuy
Reviews.Content: Big room, Clean, Kitchen, Living Room and i got all this for 59$ off Hotwire? a bargain and a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Darrenzo1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights over new years. There were 7 of us staying in 2 rooms (my wife, my self, my three kids and my parents.) Our stay was not problem free as my parents room's key was not working despite several visits from maintenance. As result as staff person had to go accompany them to their room every time. However, other than that this hotel worked well. The beds were comfortable, there was lots of space, the kitchen was looked after and stocked, the bathroom area was small but adequate. The hotel was very quiet, especially considering the number of planes overhead. It was cool while we were there so didn't try the pool, but the kids did play basketball. The breakfast was very generous and continually restocked with hot and cold items -eggs, a meat, 2 kinds of fruit, muffins, donuts, toast, bagels, yogurt, cereals. Breakfast was very busy, and all the seats were full, so there was room but just enough room for everyone. It is far from any tourist sights and is even a bit of a drive from the airport. You do need a car if you stay here. The staff was mostly helpful although the breakfast staff spoke only Spanish. We appreciated people on this site who mentioned the Staybridge is hiding behind its sister hotel - the Holiday Inn. At night it is hard to find. There was plenty of parking.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I was expecting!”
Reviews.Author: desertgirlmel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights when in Miami for New Year's. I expected a standard airport type hotel, but Staybridge Suites went above and beyond!!! The BED was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever stayed in at a hotel!!! The room, the entire hotel, and the grounds were kept spotlessly clean, and I appreciated the extra security to get in the parking lot. There were also a lot of pretty decent restaurants within a short driving distance of the hotel, not to mention just a few minutes on the highway to either downtown or South Beach. The only thing I wasn't all that thrilled about was the breakfast buffet. Overcrowded and picked over unless you get there early, and even then the food wasn't all that great. Overall, a fantastic hotel and I would definately stay there again while in the Miami area!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: PAproudBloomsburg_PA
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for the value.... It was conveniant to the highways, airports, malls, etc. You definitely need a car at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Large room, good facilities, helpful staff and OK breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Joe_33
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an odd location - and isn't near very much. I guess most of us were travelling to or from Miami airport. My room was huge and new. I had a well equiped kitchen. The internet worked fine. Front desk staff were efficient and helpful. Breakfast budgets have been cut back and this was true at this hotel. I eat the fruit but people wanting a cooked breakfast would find this basic. The lounges and seating areas near the lobby were a nice touch. The stairs were odd - going into the stair well meant that I could only exit at the ground floor - no way around the very slow elevators (only one was working) - at peak times it was painful waiting and squeezing into elevators with guests, staff, luggage and trolleys. I'd recommend this hotel as excellent value for people flying in to out of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Clean Spacious Suite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wflashy
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable hotel to stay in when on vacation. It is located about 10 minutes from the airport. We reserved a 1 bedroom suite and it had all the comforts of home, including, 2 tvs, vcr, stovetop (no oven), dishwasher, microave, full size fridge, pots, utensils, toaster, and coffee maker. The daily complimentary breakfast was adequate with the usual continental breakfast items, waffle maker and 2 hot entrees. One day it was eggs & bacon and another day it was eggs and corned beef hash. The breakfast area was well stocked, organized and clean. It was never crowded when we were there. We loved that when we returned at the end of the day there was complimentary Wolfgang Puck coffee in the lobby. Our only gripe is that the hotel is very hard to find in the dark. We got lost bc we didn't know the hotel was behind Holiday Inn. The street signage needs to be lit up for guests arriving in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: Dawn29
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay overnight on our way to Key West. The hotel & room are nice. The room included a seating area, work desk & kitchen. The location is fine not much surrounding it. The hotel offers free serve yourself buffet breakfast. It did the job. I don't care for eggs served buffet style. They had a do-it-yourself waffle station. Fruit was good and overall the meal was satisfying. We arrived late from Phl and we're starving. Doral Ale House is located directly in front of the hotel (walking distance). It's a sports bar with very good food. Definitely try this place.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay in comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jodish
Reviews.Content: We spent alot of time looking for a suitable hotel in a safe area within easy reach of the airport (due to our past midnight flight arrival) for very reasonable cost before our trip. We found Trip Advisor invaluble in all our choices when planning our whole trip. We stayed in this hotel for three nights after flying into Miami from the UK, before heading down to the Keys. The check -in was swift and efficient with personable and helpful staff. We had our 22yr old son with us too, the suite had a seperate bedroom with two double beds and TV. The lounge/diner /kitchen had a sofa and further TV. We could not fault our stay, the suite provided ample room for us all to relax and had masses of storage. Storage can be a problem in some hotels of this type as they are often aimed at the business/shortstay traveller, but we had a lot of belongings due to our total17 day trip and this was accomodated very well. The suite and its contents were immaculate in every way, the beds particulary , were very comfortable with quality bedding. The lift requires your room key to operate and the corridors were also immaculate and welcoming. The location worked very well, we used a sat nav to direct us in our hire car and still managed to miss the entrance- but we were tired. The hotel is set well back from the road and is behind the Holiday Inn, so is not immediately obvious. I understand there is also an airport shuttle service. We visited South Beach, various malls etc. all within easy travelling by car, the location was very convienient for our needs. There is a Doral Ale House restaurant in the grounds, where we had an excellent meal and then walked the few yards back to the hotel. We were reasurred by the security man in his golf buggy, but to be fair we did not ever feel in any way unsafe. The breakfast of both hot and cold items was very good indeed, the quality of the food and variety of choice was much enjoyed. We have had many trips to the USA over the years and this was by far the best complimentary breakfast we have experienced. We loved our stay in this hotel and wished we had returned to it before flying home again, we instead picked another hotel in the Kendall area for easy access to the Everglades, it was however not a patch on this one. Keep it up Staybridge you really are a treat!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive lodgings near MIA”
Reviews.Author: PeterJerrod
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Staybridge Suites on February 13. We wanted to stay near the Miami Airport since we were arriving late in the evening, so we were given this room through a $75 bid on Priceline. The room was spacious with a mini kitchen area (sort of like a studio timeshare, but since we were only staying one night, we didn't take advantage of the extra amenities). The hotel was somewhat difficult to get to...about a ten minute drive from the airport. We were told that the trip to the hotel from MIA would be about $30 each way by cab, so we decided to rent a car. The hotel is not easy to find because of lack of signage, and there were limited parking spaces available, but we did receive a wonderful room with very nice amenities. The best part was the deluxe continental breakfast served to guests in the morning, with spacious seating areas and helpful personnel. The hotel is located on a long avenue with many shops and fast food restaurants...it had a commercial feel and was not scuzzy at all. There is a 24-hour Wal-Mart down the street, which was perfect to pick up snacks and drinks for our fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Unconfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: fbiaze
Reviews.Content: I have spent just one night after a cuise at this Staybridge. Got a good $50 rate at Priceline, and wi-fi, parking and breakfest were included. Our room was very nice, with a queen bed, a working area, a mini-kitchen and a sitting area. Altough it was clean, the bed was not confortable. They have free shuttles to mia airport, which was good. Breakfest is ok. Service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: btracing03234
Reviews.Content: Staff ( especially Diana Alaniz, who checked us in) were very friendly and helpful. The room (a studio suite), was clean and comfortable, with kitchen area, couch area, and bedroom area. Although we did not use it, a desk area with free wireless internet was available in the room. There was a dining area (for the free breakfast buffet)off the Lobby, a fitness room, and a library, and hard- wired computers were available in a room off the Lobby. The hot breakfast buffet was included in the room rate and items were plentiful and kept restocked, with a great variety of hot and cold items. The hotel had many safety features, including use of room keycard to get to and from rooms via elevator. It offers most amenities to rate it as 3 star hotel. The hotel appears to be in a safe area in Miami. You do need a car to get around, as I did not see public transportation available in that area, although we may have missed it and did not ask. We recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again if in Miami. Elizabeth Thompson Date of stay 10/18/08

Reviews.Title: “Great for passing thru Miami...try Cuban restaurant they recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Lvv2trvl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a quick overnight en route from Dominican Republic back to SFO. We were pleasantly surprised. The suite was simple but clean, no frills. The free shuttle service was superb. It did the job what we were looking for. The highlight for us, however, was the Gourmet Cuban restaurant one of the front desk girls recommended. We had never eaten Cuban food, so wanted to give it a shot. OMG, we were completely blown away by La Rosa's Cuban Restaurant. The Staybridge gives you a free shuttle ride over there, and believe it or not that was one of the highlights of our trip! The beef tenderloin was unbelievable and the fish outstanding. Not to mention the fried green banana chips that taste better than potato chips, I kid you not. The only drawback is that the early morning (5amish) staff is not as attentive as the evening staff, but overall we were happy with our stay. And DEFINITELY try La Rosa's Cuban Restaurant!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel/Staff”
Reviews.Author: toto4712
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel

Reviews.Title: “good location, clean and functional”
Reviews.Author: rumrunnerfrank
Reviews.Content: on a quick business trip to miami and decided to take wife and small children. staybridge suites is very convenient to a myriad of business locations in the airport and doral areas. after business completed on friday, we decided to do metro zoo on saturday and then on sunday we grabbed lunch at bayside before flying home. contrary to another review that hotel is inconvenient to activities, we were at metro zoo in 20 minutes, and about the same to bayside (downtown waterfront shopping area). i will note that traffic in the area is pretty intense on weekdays during rush hour, but that's to be expected in any large metro area. there are dozens of nearby restaurants to suit all tastes. as for the hotel itself: the rooms are ideal for traveling with small children (or on solo business). internet in rooms, small kitchenette with medium sized refrigerator, microwave and stove. the living room had a couch and a nice t.v. the bedroom was cramped with two full sized beds. overall, the furnishings seemed nice and functional. the room was clean. the staff was friendly, eagerly providing directions when asked. no problem getting more towels, etc when needed. the hotel property shares a pool with the adjacent holiday inn and it looked nice, but we didn't use it. breakfast was fine. plenty of everything and not too crowded on the weekend. it's one of those hotels that caters to weekday business travelers. all in all, we'd defenitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Some problems but its okay overall”
Reviews.Author: fjnovak1
Reviews.Content: Breakfast buffet was running out of items before 9:00 and they were not replaced....bedding was not that comfortable and the rooms were not laid out well for a suite-style hotel. The property seemed to be in decent shape but is not in the best area. There are, however, many places to eat in the immediate area. Not the best location for things to do activities-wise.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: plato1234
Reviews.Content: We noted that during our stay the hotel was undergoing some renovations, but those aside we were somewhat disappointed with the hotel, especially in comparison with other Staybridge Suites locations we have stayed at in California and New York. We were surprised and disappointed that basic microwave cooking utensils were not available when requested, for example, and that the television picture was terrible. A request for the later to be addressed went unanswered as did a request for an extra chair. The windows in the room were streaked and dirty and there was mold on the edge of the tub in the bathroom. The garberator came apart when we used it, and the general appearance of the hotel entry was scruffy, including the elevator and room furnishings. The mattress on the bed also seemed old and tired. Food service was also not up to the standard we experienced at California locations.

HotelInfo.Name: Staybridge Suites Miami Doral Area
HotelInfo.Address: 3265 NW 87th Avenue, Miami, FL 33172
